What’s New in Tetrad X.Y

This page highlights changes since the previous release. Replace X.Y with your release number and drop this file into the manual’s navigation.

Highlights

  • Indicator expansion in Data ▸ Transform: one-click discrete→{0,1} dummies (k−1 columns) while preserving rank.
  • Bootstrap “Without replacement”: exact subsampling setting for small N experiments.
  • Markov Checker: quick U(0,1) sanity check of implied independences (with tips on interpreting deviations).
  • IDA Checker: CPDAG-wide min effect range auditing against true effects.
  • Algcomparison: batch comparisons across simulations/algorithms/scores with exportable tables.
  • Builds now on JDK 21 with language level 24.

Data Transformations

Indicator Expansion

Convert a discrete column into k−1 indicator columns: Data ▸ Transform ▸ Indicator. Keeps matrices full rank for regression/SEM.

Tip: Prefer indicators over arbitrary integer encodings; the latter induce spurious order.

Resampling

Bootstrap “Without replacement”

Enable Without replacement in the bootstrap dialog to perform exact subsampling. Useful when N is small and classical bootstrap overstates stability.

Model Checking

Markov Checker

Lists implied independences (by the graph) and their data p-values. Under the Markov Condition, p-values are approximately U(0,1). Use a quick histogram or A–D / K–S test to spot violations.

Screenshot placeholder: Markov Checker results table + simple histogram panel.

IDA Checker

Computes IDA min-effect ranges for all (X,Y) pairs in a linear CPDAG and checks whether true SEM-IM effects fall within ranges.

Screenshot placeholder: IDA summary table with a highlighted mismatch example.

Algorithm Comparisons

Algcomparison

Run grids over simulations × algorithms × scores/tests and export tables of edge/arrowhead metrics and timings. See the in-box Help tab for column definitions.

Build & Compatibility

  • JDK: 21
  • Language level: 24
  • Feature availability varies by graph/data type (see each box page).
